item.title: Uncollected leaves causing hazards, 10th November
item.description:
There is a large build-up of fallen leaves along the pavement on this street (see attached photo). The leaves have accumulated over time and now cover most of the walking area. They are already breaking down, becoming wet, slippery, and compacted, which makes the pavement difficult and unsafe to walk on. This has been the case for months as council waits until Christmas to pick them up. This is causing several problems: Slip Hazard: Wet, decaying leaves become very slippery. This is particularly dangerous for elderly residents, people pushing prams, and schoolchildren. Reduced Walkway Width: The leaves are piled up along the edge of the pavement, forcing pedestrians to walk closer to the road or step onto uneven surfaces. Blocked Drainage: The leaves are gathering along the curb and can easily block drains, increasing the risk of water pooling and local flooding when it rains. General Neglect: The area now looks poorly maintained, which affects the overall appearance of the neighbourhood.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Westbury Road, Woodside Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant Fly-Tipping!!, 10th November
item.description:
Around 7:30–8:00pm a resident from the estate was seen dumping a boiler from his van (Asil Ates Ltd) This is shocking and dangerous, especially with a children’s playground nearby. Hackney please take action fly-tipping like this is constant and so blatant

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Loddiges Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
